H0.text: The bouncing back of waves as they meet a surface is the description of diffraction as requested by the question “Which of the following describes diffraction?”.

H1.text: The bending of waves as they pass from one medium to another describes diffraction.

H2.text: The bending of waves as they pass an edge or an opening describes diffraction.

H3.text: The combining of two waves that meet at a point describes diffraction.

A4.text: Diffraction is the deviation of waves from straight-line propagation without any change in their energy due to an obstacle or through an aperture.
